title: Go Tell It on the Mountain - repeats "seeming"

content.question: Which of the following best describes the effect produced by the repetition of the words "seeming" and "seemed" throughout the passage?

choices.label: It serves to emphasize John's particular, individual perspective on the events described.
It functions as a reminder to the reader that the speaker is only telling a story.
It suggests that John's memory of the events described is vague and indistinct.
It provides support for the extended allegory developed in the passage.

content.answer: It serves to emphasize John's particular, individual perspective on the events described.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain the function of specific words and phrases in a text.
